text: Desmond Michael Lynam (born 17 September 1942) is an Irish television and radio presenter. He was born in Ennis, County Clare, Republic of Ireland. He was best known for presenting the BBC's sport coverage such as Grandstand. Lynam also presented Countdown on Channel 4 from 2005 to 2006. He was replaced by Des O'Connor. == Other websites == * Category:Game show hosts Category:Irish television personalities Category:People from County Clare Category:Irish radio personalities Category:Irish television presenters Category:1942 births Category:Living people
title: Des Lynam
